entry.title: The Potatoes Originating in Egypt (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Potatoes Originating in Egypt Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2004 (S.R. 2004 No. 183). They implement Commission Implementing Decision 2011/787/EU (O.J. No. L.319, 2.12.2011, p.112), which repeals Commission Decision 2004/4/EC and as amended. They authorise Member States temporarily to take additional measures against the dissemination of Ralstonia solanacearum (Smith) Yabuuchi et al. as regards Egypt.

entry.title: The Welfare Reform Act 2009 (Commencement No.8) Order 2012

ukm:Subject.Value: REGISTRATION OF BIRTHS, DEATHS, MARRIAGES, ETC, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: REGISTRATION OF BIRTHS, DEATHS, MARRIAGES, ETC, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: This Order brings into force, on 21st May 2012, section 3(1) of the Welfare Reform Act 2009 in so far as it inserts subsection (1A) into section 124 of the Social Security Contributions and Benefits Act 1992 (SSCBA). Section 124(1A) of the SSCBA requires regulations setting out the prescribed categories of person who are entitled to income support must include lone parents who have a child under the age of five. (Section 124(1A) was amended by section 58 of the Welfare Reform Act 2012 with effect from 20th March 2012 so as to substitute the age of five for the age of seven.)

entry.title: The Traffic Management (Doncaster Borough Council) Permit Scheme Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order gives effect to the Doncaster Borough Council Permit Scheme.

entry.title: The Road Traffic (Parking Adjudicators) (South Ayrshire Council) Regulations 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations prescribe the procedure to be followed in relation to appeals before parking adjudicators against decisions of the parking authority under a decriminalised parking regime in South Ayrshire Council (regulations 3-16). The parking adjudicators are appointed under section 73 of the Road Traffic Act 1991 (“the 1991 Act”). That section along with other provisions of that Act relating to the decriminalisation of certain parking offences is applied with modifications where appropriate to South Ayrshire Council parking area by the Road Traffic (Permitted Parking Area and Special Parking Area) (South Ayrshire Council) Designation Order 2012.

entry.title: The Nationality, Immigration and Asylum Act 2002 (Commencement No. 13) Order 2012
entry.summary: To the extent they are not already in force for the purposes mentioned in article 2(3), this Order brings into force the provisions of the Nationality, Immigration and Asylum Act 2002 mentioned in article 2(2) for those purposes on the day after the day on which this Order is made.

entry.title: The Road Traffic (Parking Adjudicators) (East Ayrshire Council) Regulations 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations prescribe the procedure to be followed in relation to appeals before parking adjudicators against decisions of the parking authority under a decriminalised parking regime in East Ayrshire Council (regulations 3-16). The parking adjudicators are appointed under section 73 of the Road Traffic Act 1991 (“the 1991 Act”). That section along with other provisions of that Act relating to the decriminalisation of certain parking offences is applied with modifications where appropriate to East Ayrshire Council parking area by the Road Traffic (Permitted Parking Area and Special Parking Area) (East Ayrshire Council) Designation Order 2012.

entry.title: The Traffic Management (Sheffield City Council) Permit Scheme Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order gives effect to the Sheffield City Council Permit Scheme.

entry.title: The Rural Payments (Appeals) (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Rural Payments (Appeals)(Scotland) Regulations 2009 (“the 2009 Regulations”) which provide for a right of review and appeal in relation to certain decisions of the Scottish Ministers (a “relevant decision” as listed in the Schedule to the 2009 Regulations). Those include decisions made for the purposes of various EU instruments which implement the Common Agricultural Policy, and in relation to holdings administered by the Scottish Ministers under the Common Agricultural Policy Single Payment and Support Schemes (Integrated Administration and Control System) Regulations 2005 or the Common Agricultural Policy Single Payment and Support Schemes (Integrated Administration and Control System) Regulations 2009 (“the IACS Regulations”), which may be partly situated elsewhere in the UK.

entry.title: The Road Traffic (Permitted Parking Area and Special Parking Area) (South Ayrshire Council) Designation Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order extends to South Ayrshire Council arrangements for enforcing parking controls already available in London and certain other areas in England and in Edinburgh, Glasgow, Perth and Kinross, Aberdeen, Dundee, South Lanarkshire and Renfrewshire. It does so by designating South Ayrshire local government area (with certain specified exceptions) as a permitted parking area and as a special parking area in accordance with Schedule3 to the Road Traffic Act 1991 (“the 1991 Act”). The Order applies to the designated area various provisions of the 1991 Act and modifies them where necessary. It also makes consequential modifications to certain provisions of the Road Traffic Regulation Act 1984 (“the 1984 Act”) dealing with parking and related matters.

entry.title: The Road Traffic (Permitted Parking Area and Special Parking Area) (East Ayrshire Council) Designation Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order extends to East Ayrshire Council arrangements for enforcing parking controls already available in London and certain other areas in England and in Edinburgh, Glasgow, Perth and Kinross, Aberdeen, Dundee, South Lanarkshire and Renfrewshire. It does so by designating East Ayrshire local government area (with certain specified exceptions) as a permitted parking area and as a special parking area in accordance with Schedule3 to the Road Traffic Act 1991 (“the 1991 Act”). The Order applies to the designated area various provisions of the 1991 Act and modifies them where necessary. It also makes consequential modifications to certain provisions of the Road Traffic Regulation Act 1984 (“the 1984 Act”) dealing with parking and related matters.

entry.title: The Welfare Reform Act 2012 (Commencement No. 2) Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order is the second Commencement Order made under the Welfare Reform Act 2012 (“the Act”). It brings into force to the extent set out in the Order sections 44(5), 45, 46, 48, 105, 106, 116 and 122 to 125 of, and paragraphs 1, 2, 3, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10(1) and (3), 12 and 16(1) and (2)(c) of Schedule 7 and Part 3 of Schedule 14 to, the Act.

entry.title: The Student Fees (Amounts) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Student Fees (Amounts) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2005 (“the 2005 Regulations”) by increasing the basic and higher amounts prescribed in the 2005 Regulations. The amendments come into operation on 1st September 2013.

entry.title: The Prison Service (Pay Review Body) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations provides for the Pay Review Body established by the Prison Service (Pay Review Body) Regulations 2001 to examine and report on the rates of pay and allowances of prison officers in response to matters referred to them by the Department of Justice.

entry.title: Act of Sederunt (Actions for removing from heritable property) 2012
entry.summary: This Act of Sederunt prescribes the practice and procedure to be followed in the execution of any decree for removing from heritable property.

title.div: The Education (Listed Bodies) (Wales) Order 2012 / Gorchymyn Addysg (Cyrff sy'n Cael eu Rhestru) (Cymru) 2012

div.p: This Order lists the name of every body which is not a recognised body within section 216(4) of the Education Reform Act 1988 but which appears to the Welsh Ministers to either—

Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn yn rhestru enw pob corff nad yw'n gorff sy'n cael ei gydnabod o fewn adran 216(4) o Ddeddf Diwygio Addysg 1988, ond sy'n gorff y mae'n ymddangos i Weinidogion Cymru ei fod naill ai—

title.div: The Mental Health (Hospital, Guardianship, Community Treatment and Consent to Treatment) (Wales) (Amendment) Regulations 2012 / Rheoliadau Iechyd Meddwl (Ysbyty, Gwarcheidiaeth, Triniaeth Gymunedol a Chydsynio i Driniaeth) (Cymru) (Diwygio) 2012

div.p: These Regulations amend the Mental Health (Hospital, Guardianship, Community Treatment and Consent to Treatment) (Wales) Regulations 2008 (S.I. 2008/2439 (W.212)) (“the 2008 Regulations”).
Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn diwygio Rheoliadau Iechyd Meddwl (Ysbyty, Gwarcheidiaeth, Triniaeth Gymunedol a Chydsynio i Driniaeth) (Cymru) 2008 (O.S. 2008/2439 (Cy.212)) (“Rheoliadau 2008”).

title.div: The Recognised Persons (Monetary Penalties) (Determination of Turnover) (Wales) Order 2012 / Gorchymyn Personau Cydnabyddedig (Cosbau Ariannol) (Penderfynu Trosiant) (Cymru) 2012

div.p: This Order makes provision for the determination of turnover of a recognised person for the purposes of section 32AB of the Education Act 1997 (“the 1997 Act”).
Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn yn gwneud darpariaeth ar gyfer penderfynu trosiant person cydnabyddedig (“recognised person”) at ddibenion adran 32AB o Ddeddf Addysg 1997 (“Deddf 1997”).

title.div: The Education (Recognised Bodies) (Wales) Order 2012 / Gorchymyn Addysg (Cyrff sy'n Cael eu Cydnabod) (Cymru) 2012

div.p: This Order lists all the bodies appearing to the Welsh Ministers to be recognised bodies within section 214 (2)(a) or (b) of the Education Reform Act 1988. Such bodies are either:

Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn yn rhestru'r holl gyrff y mae'n ymddangos i Weinidogion Cymru eu bod yn gyrff sy'n cael eu cydnabod o fewn ystyr adran 214(2)(a) neu (b) o Ddeddf Diwygio Addysg 1988. Mae cyrff o'r fath naill ai:

entry.title: The Velindre National Health Service Trust (Establishment) (Amendment) Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order further amends the Velindre National Health Service Trust (Establishment) Order 1993 in order to amend the functions of Velindre National Health Service Trust.

title.div: The Mink Keeping (Prohibition) (Wales) Order 2012 / Gorchymyn Cadw Mincod (Gwahardd) (Cymru) 2012

div.p: This Order, in exercise of the power granted by section 10 of the Destructive Imported Animals Act 1932 (“the Act”), prohibits the keeping of mink in Wales.
Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn, drwy arfer y pŵer a roddwyd gan adran 10 o Ddeddf Anifeiliaid Dinistriol a Fewnforir 1932 (“y Ddeddf”), yn gwahardd cadw mincod yng Nghymru.
